column1: '''Molly''' was one of the children who attended the [[Feast of Good Children]] when [[Smith Smithson]] ate the [[Fay-star]] that had been put in the [[Great Cake]].  Long after he had retired
column4: was trying to figure out who had swallowed the Fay-star and he remembered Molly
column5: the Miller's daughter.  Nokes claimed that Molly had been greedy and had bolted her food
column6: and later had become as fat as a sack.  [[Alf]]
column7: who had been Nokes' apprentice at the time
column8: said that Molly had not bolted her food and had not eaten the star since she found two trinkets in her slice.<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
